description: Numbers n such that n and EulerPhi(n) have same number of prime factors, counted without multiplicity.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 3 and 5 known Fermat-primes belong here because their Phi is divided only by 2. Several composites are also here, like {50,999,1000} with (2,5),(3,37) and (2,5) prime divisors and their phi,{20,648,400} have also 2 factors: (2,5),(2,3),(2,5)
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 11 2000
extensions: Definition clarified by _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 12 2014
